data.title: Willie Hope Graham Obituary in Gastonia at Costner Funeral Home
data.meta_description: Costner Funeral Home | Gastonia, NC in Gastonia respectfully announces the passing of Willie Hope Graham on February 16, 2022.
data.text:
Obituary For Willie Hope Graham

Mr. Willie Hope Graham, son of the late John Edward and Amanda Setzer Graham, was born April 7,1945, in Gaston County, North Carolina. Willie was called home to be with the Lord on February 16, 2022, at Brian Center, Gastonia, North Carolina.

Willie was a member of Pleasant Grove Missionary Baptist Church in Bowling Green, SC, where he was a member and one of the lead singers of the Pleasant Grove Gospel Chorus. Willie Hope was gifted as a lead guitarist. He had a beautiful baritone voice. He sang: “Oh Mary, Don’t You Weep,” “Don’t Doubt Me Thomas”, “I Can Feel Him Watching Over Me” and “Tis the Old Ship of Zion.”

In addition to parents, he was preceded in death by his sisters and brothers-in-law: Alice Armstrong (Odell), Betty Kendrick (James) Nellie Adams, Katie Graham and Edith Graham; brothers and sister-in-law: George Graham (Annie), Charles Graham, Leonard Graham.

He leaves to cherish his memory, his loving and devoted wife of 52 years, Sally Kendrick Graham; his only daughter, whom he loved dearly, Angela Michelle Graham Armstrong (Chad); his grandchildren: Chassity and Kyla Armstrong, Malai Moorman (Brock) and Asa Hood; one great-granddaughter, Maya Moorman, mother-in-love: Minnie Kendrick, sisters-in-law: Sarah Graham, Rose Armstrong, Jennie Bigger (Fred), Peggy Adams, Sabrina Kendrick, Adeline Adams; brothers-in-law: Hazel Knox (Mary), Andre Huskey and a host of nieces and nephews, relatives, and friends.

Funeral Arrangements Are As Follow:

Place: Pleasant Grove Baptist Church, Bowling Green, South Carolina.

Date: Wednesday, February 23, 2022

Burial: Church Cemetery

Public Viewing: At the funeral home Tuesday from 3:00 until 8:00 pm.

Send flowers to the service of Willie Hope Graham
